name: Software Development Lifecycle
shortDescription: Systematic approach to software development phases

steps.name: Planning - Define requirements and scope
steps.description:
Establish project objectives, scope, timeline, and resource requirements

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Think deeply about what we're assuming about user needs, technical constraints, and project scope. What could we be missing?

steps.name: Analysis - Analyze requirements and feasibility
steps.description: Detailed analysis of functional and non-functional requirements

steps.name: Design - Create system architecture and design
steps.description:
Design system architecture, database schema, and user interfaces

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Think deeply about how similar systems solve these problems. What design patterns and architectural approaches could work here?

steps.name: Implementation - Code and build the solution
steps.description: Write code, implement features, and integrate system components

steps.name: Testing - Verify functionality and quality
steps.description: Execute test plans to verify system meets requirements and quality standards

steps.name: Deployment - Release to production
steps.description: Deploy system to production environment and configure for live use

steps.name: Maintenance - Monitor and maintain the system
steps.description:
Ongoing monitoring, bug fixes, updates, and system improvements

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Think deeply about what long-term issues and evolution needs we might face. What maintenance patterns are we establishing?
